results.adx_keywords: Norovirus;Diarrhea;Dehydration;Hygiene and Cleanliness;Disease Rates;Content Type: Service;United States
results.title: Oh, No. Time to Worry About Norovirus Again.
results.abstract: Nausea, vomiting, stomach pain: The illness is contagious (and highly unpleasant).

results.adx_keywords: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);Military Aircraft;Espionage and Intelligence Services;United States Politics and Government;United States Defense and Military Forces;United States International Relations;Trudeau, Justin;Biden, Joseph R Jr;North American Aerospace Defense Command;Alaska;China;Canada
results.title: U.S. Jet Shoots Down Flying Object Over Canada
results.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he and President Biden had ordered the object violating Canadian airspace to be taken down, a day after another object was shot out of the sky near Alaska.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.adx_keywords: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);United States Defense and Military Forces;North American Aerospace Defense Command;Canada;Alaska
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper and Edward Wong
results.title: What’s Going On Up There? Theories but No Answers in Shootdowns of Mystery Craft.
results.abstract: The U.S. and Canada are investigating three unidentified flying objects shot down over North America in the past three days. Militaries have adjusted radars to try to spot more incursions.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The Pentagon and intelligence agencies have intensified their study of unexplained incidents near military bases in recent years.

results.adx_keywords: Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Classified Information and State Secrets;Smith, Jack (Attorney);Garland, Merrick B;Trump, Donald J;Justice Department
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
results.title: Jack Smith, Special Counsel for Trump Inquiries, Steps Up the Pace
results.abstract: Named less than three months ago to oversee investigations into Donald J. Trump’s efforts to hold onto power and his handling of classified documents, the special counsel is moving aggressively.

media.caption: Jack Smith has kept a low profile, making no public appearances and sticking to a long pattern of empowering subordinates rather than interposing himself directly in investigations.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Colleges and Universities;Kohberger, Bryan C;Chapin, Ethan (d 2022);Goncalves, Kaylee (d 2022);Kernodle, Xana (d 2022);Mogen, Madison (d 2022);University of Idaho;Washington State University;Moscow (Idaho)
results.byline: By Mike Baker and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
results.title: University Investigated Idaho Murder Suspect’s Behavior Around Time of Killings
results.abstract: Bryan Kohberger had a verbal altercation with a professor and was investigated over his behavior around female students before he was charged in four murders.

media.caption: Bryan Kohberger was studying criminology at Washington State University in Pullman, Wash., at the time of the murders.

results.adx_keywords: Automobiles;Robberies and Thefts;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Children and Childhood;Elias Armstrong;Denver (Colo)
results.title: Boy, 12, Is Fatally Shot by Owner of Stolen Car in Denver, Police Say
results.abstract: The boy was in the car when the vehicle’s owner found it using an app and “exchanged fire” with the people inside, the police said.

media.caption: Elias Armstrong, 12, died at Denver Health Medical Center after being shot by the owner of a stolen vehicle, the authorities said.
media.copyright: Kathryn Scott/The Denver Post, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Football;Super Bowl;Rap and Hip-Hop;Rihanna
results.title: After a Long Hiatus, a Pregnant Rihanna Returns on the Super Bowl Stage
results.abstract: Rihanna did not bring any other artists to the stage, preferring to frame the set as a celebration of her dominant pop career. The performance also served as a pregnancy reveal.

media.caption: Rihanna performing during the halftime show of Super Bowl LVII at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Ariz., on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Traffic Accidents and Safety;Airlines and Airplanes;Airports;Buses;Los Angeles International Airport;American Airlines;Federal Aviation Administration
results.title: Plane and Bus Collide at Los Angeles Airport, Injuring 5, Officials Say
results.abstract: An American Airlines jet that was not carrying passengers struck a shuttle bus on Friday night in what was the latest in a spate of unusual incidents at major airports.

results.adx_keywords: Advertising and Marketing;Super Bowl;Religion and Belief
results.title: What is ‘He Gets Us’?
results.abstract: The campaign aims to increase the relevance of Jesus in American culture, according to the agency behind the ads. David Green, the founder of Hobby Lobby, has said he is a donor.

media.caption: A scene from the 30-second Super Bowl ad created by the Servant Foundation for its “He Gets Us” campaign.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Mortgages;Interest Rates;United States Economy;United States
results.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Ben Casselman
results.title: When It’s Easy to Be a Landlord, No One Wants to Sell
results.abstract: Locked in at historically low interest rates. Platforms that make managing rentals a breeze. Homeowners have little incentive to put a house on the market.

media.caption: Like many owners, Selma Hepp owns a rental property that she could sell, but is holding off for the time being.
media.copyright: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elderly;Population;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Euthanasia and Assisted Suicide;Colleges and Universities;Content Type: Personal Profile;Narita, Yusuke;Yale University;Japan
results.byline: By Motoko Rich and Hikari Hida
results.title: A Yale Professor Suggested Mass Suicide for Old People in Japan. What Did He Mean?
results.abstract: Yusuke Narita says he is mainly addressing a growing effort to revamp Japan’s age-based hierarchies. Still, he has pushed the country’s hottest button.

media.caption: Yusuke Narita, wearing his signature eyeglasses with one round and one square lens. He said his comments about mass suicide and the elderly had been “taken out of context.”
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: State Legislatures;Politics and Government;Amusement and Theme Parks;Corporate Taxes;Law and Legislation;DeSantis, Ron;Disney, Walt, World (Lake Buena Vista, Fla);Walt Disney Company;Florida
results.title: DeSantis Declares Victory as Disney Is Stripped of Some 56-Year-Old Perks
results.abstract: The Legislature approved a bill that restricts the autonomy of Florida’s largest private employer over a fight involving the teaching of sexual orientation and gender identity.
org_facet: Disney, Walt, World (Lake Buena Vista, Fla)

media.caption: For more than five decades, Disney has effectively been able to self-govern its 25,000-acre theme park complex in Florida.

results.adx_keywords: vis-photo;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Cold and Cold Spells;Heating;Russia;Ukraine;Kivsharivka (Ukraine)
results.title: ‘Ordinary Russians Want Us to Freeze to Death’
results.abstract: “My children left, but I don’t want to. I warm myself with an electric heater when there is power,” Alyona Kovalyova said.

media.caption: A damaged bridge over the Siversky Donets River in the Kharkiv region.

results.adx_keywords: Manhattan, NY, Attack (October, 2017);Capital Punishment;Terrorism;Saipov, Sayfullo;New York City
results.byline: By Benjamin Weiser and Lola Fadulu
results.title: Terror Trial Could Yield Manhattan’s First Death Penalty in 60 Years
results.abstract: Sayfullo Saipov was convicted of fatally mowing down eight people in a 2017 bike-path rampage in New York. Will 12 jurors vote to execute him?

media.caption: The family of Ann-Laure Decadt, who died in the attack. Their home country, Belgium, has abolished capital punishment.
media.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Television;Longo, Cody (1988-2023)
results.title: Cody Longo, ‘Days of Our Lives’ Actor, Dies at 34
results.abstract: A singer, songwriter and music producer, as well as an actor, Mr. Longo also appeared in the TV series “Hollywood Heights” and in movies.

media.caption: Cody Longo at the 2018 MTV Video Music Awards in New York City. He had struggled with alcohol addiction for several years, his representative said.

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Civilian Casualties;Putin, Vladimir V;Russia;Bakhmut (Ukraine);Ukraine
results.title: They Are Russians Fighting Against Their Homeland. Here’s Why.
results.abstract: In the Free Russia Legion, soldiers repelled by Vladimir Putin’s invasion have taken arms against their home country, engaged in some of the most heated fighting in the war.

media.caption: Soldiers with the Free Russia Legion training this month in the Kyiv region in Ukraine in preparation to deploy to the front lines.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Movies;Holocaust and the Nazi Era;Jews and Judaism;Perel, Solomon;Yad Vashem Holocaust Museum;Lodz (Poland);Germany
results.title: Solomon Perel, Jew Who Posed as a Hitler Youth to Survive, Dies at 97
results.abstract: His masquerade — a tale recounted in a memoir and in the film “Europa Europa” — saved his life. But “to this day,” he said, “I have a tangle of two souls in one body.”

media.caption: Solomon Perel in an undated photo. “I’m not a Jew,” he lied to his Wehrmacht captors in 1941. “I’m an ethnic German.”

results.adx_keywords: Rap and Hip-Hop;Deaths (Obituaries);Trugoy the Dove;De La Soul
results.title: De La Soul’s David Jolicoeur, Who Rapped as Trugoy the Dove, Dies at 54
results.abstract: The trio expanded the stylistic vocabulary of hip-hop in the 1980s and ’90s, but its early experiments with sampling led to legal troubles, and the group’s longtime exclusion from streaming.

media.caption: David Jolicoeur of De La Soul performing in Mountain View, Calif., in 2019. The group arrived with the album “Three Feet High and Rising” in 1989.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Education (Secondary);St Paul (Minn)
results.title: Student Fatally Stabs Another at Minnesota High School, Police Say
results.abstract: The stabbing, which happened at Harding High School in St. Paul on Friday, was the first homicide in the city this year, the police said.

media.caption: Staff members leave Harding High School in St. Paul, Minn., after a student was fatally stabbed on Friday.
media.copyright: Aaron Lavinsky/Star Tribune, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Drug Abuse and Traffic;Drug Cartels;Bribery and Kickbacks;Politics and Government;Corruption (Institutional);Garcia Luna, Genaro;Guzman Loera, Joaquin;Sinaloa Cartel;Mexico
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maria Abi-Habib
results.title: Corruption Trial of Mexican Ex-Lawman Ripples Beyond Courtroom
results.abstract: As prosecutors close their case against Genaro García Luna, the eventual verdict will be felt by Mexican officials and among U.S. agents who work there.

media.caption: Genaro Garciá Luna, who once served as the public face of Mexico’s war on drugs, is accused of taking millions in bribes from the very cartels he was supposed to be pursuing.
